"SECTION 1. AMENDMENTS." "AMENDMENTS: Section 8332(b) of title 5, United States Code is amended to include service before 1977 with Air America, Air Asia Company Limited, or the Pacific Division of Southern Air Transport, when owned or controlled by the US Government and managed by the CIA." Service before 1977 with Air America, Air Asia Company Limited, or the Pacific Division of Southern Air Transport, when owned or controlled by the US Government and managed by the CIA, shall be considered as service as an employee. The Office of Personnel Management will accept the certification of the Director of Central Intelligence or his designee regarding such service. Additionally, any service for which credit is allowed under section 8332(b)(18) of title 5, United States Code, is exempt from the deposit requirement. SEC. 2. APPLICABILITY. The amendments made by this Act apply to annuities starting on or after the effective date. Current annuitants can request a recomputation of their annuity amount within 2 years of the Act's effective date. The recomputed amount will be effective from the annuity's start date, with any additional payments before the recomputation reflected in a lump-sum payment. Any individual eligible for an annuity under the Act can choose to have their annuity calculated as if the amendments were already in effect by submitting an application within 2 years of the Act's effective date or their separation from service. Any individual eligible for an annuity under the Act can choose to have their annuity calculated as if the amendments were already in effect by submitting an application within 2 years of the Act's effective date or their separation from service. Entitlement to an annuity or increased annuity resulting from the application shall be effective as of the commencement date of such annuity, with any amounts payable before regular monthly annuity payments begin being paid as a lump-sum. The Act allows individuals eligible for an annuity to apply as if the amendments were already in effect, within 2 years of the Act's effective date or separation from service. The regulations also include provisions for filing on behalf of a deceased individual, following the order of precedence in the United States Code. The Act allows survivors to apply for lump-sum payments within 2 years of the Act's effective date or 1 year after the decedent's death, following the order of precedence in the United States Code. SEC. 3. FUNDING. Lump-sum payments under section 2 will be paid from the Civil Service Retirement and Disability Fund. Any increase in the unfunded liability of the Civil Service Retirement System due to this Act will be financed according to section 8348(f) of title 5, United States Code. SEC. 4. REGULATIONS AND SPECIAL RULE. The Director of the Office of Personnel Management, in consultation with the Director of Central Intelligence, will prescribe regulations to implement the Act. These regulations will include rules similar to those under the Federal Employees' Retirement System Act for certain services. The Director of Central Intelligence will also prescribe regulations for retirement systems under their administration as a result of the Act. The Act will result in regulations being prescribed by the Director of Central Intelligence in consultation with the Office of Personnel Management. Special rules will apply for benefits computed based on certain services, with adjustments made for the effective date of the Act. SEC. 5. DEFINITIONS. This Act defines terms such as "unfunded liability", "survivor", and "survivor annuitant". The term "annuity" includes a survivor annuity. SEC. 6. EFFECTIVE DATE. The Act will take effect on the first day of the first fiscal year after enactment.
